newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Sappi says workers strike at Adamas mill.
newsitem.headline: Sappi says workers strike at Adamas mill.

text.p: South African paper company Sappi Ltd said on Thursday that workers had gone on strike at its Adamas mill in Port Elizabeth after a breakdown in wage talks.
A company statement said 200 workers, members of the Paper, Printing, Wood and Allied Workers' Union, had gone on strike at the plant on Wednesday and stayed out on Thursday.
"The union is demanding a 10 percent annual wage increase and Sappi is offering an increase of six percent now, followed by a further four percent in six months' time," the statement said.
"The striking workers have left the mill premises and all is calm at the mill," Sappi added.
It did not say if or when wage talks might resume.
